alert.note: Alert for Whatcom (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 12:19PM PST until January 30 at 8:12AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Nooksack River At Ferndale affecting Whatcom County. .Flooding continues on the Nooksack River due to this morning`s heavy rainfall. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nooksack River at Ferndale. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, the river will flood additional areas within the City of Ferndale including low-lying residential areas and roads including Washington Street, Portal Way and Second Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM PST Sunday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 20.4 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.4 feet on 01/31/1971. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 830 PM PST.
